description.narrative: Government welfare and justice institutions in Somaliland, Somalia and Puntland adopt legislative and policy frameworks to protect boys and girls from all forms of abuse, neglect and exploitation., which contributes to Access To Justice, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, increased numbers of children in Somalia are protected from all forms of abuse, neglect and exploitation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government welfare and justice institutions in Somaliland, Somalia and Puntland adopt legislative and policy frameworks to protect boys and girls from all forms of abuse, neglect and exploitation.

description.narrative: There has been increased supportive and enabling environment for policy and legislation frameworks in Somalia. During this reporting period, UNICEF supported the Federal Government of Somalia, the Puntland Government as well as the Government in Somaliland to make progress on child rights-related legislation. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of districts that have in place free and universal birth registration service within the civil registration system, in accordance with national legal requirements
No. of child protection related legislative/policy /regulatory initiatives completed ( birth registration, juvenile justice, child rights bill, )

baseline.value: CSZ: 1) Juvenile Justice Bill drafted 2) Sexual Offences Bill drafted NWZ: 1) Birth and Death Registration bill drafted 2) Child Rights Bill drafted NEZ: 1) Implementation plan drafted for Juvenile

target.value: 2020:CSR: 1) Child Rights Bill approved by the Parliament and signed off for enforcement 2) CRC Implementation Plan rolled out (in support of Social Policy); 3) Alternative Care Policy approved and implemented NWZ: 1.) Child Rights Act; and Birth & Death Registration Act approved by parliament. NEZ: 1) Alternative care policy disseminated and implemented. 2) Juvenile Justice law disseminated and implemented.

actual.value:
2019:The Sexual Offences Bill (SOB) endorsed by the Federal Government of Somalia in May 2018 and submitted to parliament. But this gender-transformative draft legislation has not been debated as it challenges child marriage, age of consent and harmfully practices such as FGM.
The inclusive and gender-t

title.narrative: Degree of Development of the Quality Assurance System for Social Work

baseline.value: Degree programme established in SL with 40 Degrees awarded per year; No degree/cert/diploma programme in SCR or PL

target.value: 2020:40 degrees achieved in SL Certificate, diploma and degree programme established in CSR and PL

actual.value: 2019:New Social Work degree curriculum has been launched in 6 universities.

title.narrative: Number of justice professionals (Judges, police, prosecutors) that have been certified in and dealing with: (a) child offenders, and (b) child victims

target.value: 2020:CSR: 1) Child Justice Professionals appointed in 2 Federal member states Somaliland: 1) Child Justice Professionals appointed in 2 districts. Puntland: 1) Children

actual.value:
2019:Child protection desks established in 5 police stations in Benadir Region Administration.
A total of 14 children's desks are established in Police Stations in Somaliland.
In NEZ, Child friendly benches operational in four districts (Garowe, Bossaso, Gardo and Galkaio)

title.narrative: Number of child friendly Justice facilities (Childrens Desks at Police, Child Frendly Bench at Courts) set up for children in contact with the law.

target.value: 2020:CSR: 1) Children's Desk established in at least 2 further additional federal member states. 2) Case management including legal aid, diversion, and community reintegration of children in contact with the law. Somaliland: 1) Children's Desk established in at least 2further additional districts. 2) Case management including legal aid, diversion, and community reintegration of children in contact with the law: Puntland: 1) Children's Desk established in further 8 additional districts.

actual.value:
2019:Total: Child protection desks established in 5 police stations in Benadir Region Administration.
A total of 14 children's desks are established in Police Stations in Somaliland.
In NEZ, Child friendly benches operational in four districts (Garowe, Bossaso, Gardo and Galkaio)
